title: Alternate wetting and drying (AWD)--using less water to grow rice

tasks.task: Implementation of Alternate Wetting and Drying (AWD) technique for water-efficient rice farming
subtasks: Familiarizing with AWD technique for reducing water use in rice fields
Understanding the optimal water depth for rice plants (5 cm during flowering and grain filling)
Observing weeds in early crop growth stages and adjusting AWD timing if necessary
Monitoring the 15 cm water depth threshold using a field water tube
Constructing a field water tube from available materials (e.g., plastic pipe, bamboo)
Drilling holes in the bottom 20 cm of the field water tube for proper water level measurement
Placing the field water tube in the rice field near the bund, ensuring it is 1 meter away from the edge
Ensuring proper functionality by verifying water levels inside and outside the tube
Starting Safe AWD a few days after transplanting or when direct-seeded rice is 10 cm tall
Applying nitrogen fertilizer on dry soil prior to irrigation
Adjusting AWD practice by lowering the water depth threshold to 20, 25, 30 cm or deeper as confidence builds
Promoting AWD adoption at the community or system level for maximum impact and water savings
